subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: LiDAR Reveals Hidden Worlds
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: LiDAR Reveals Hidden Worlds.

hook.text: LiDAR shoots millions of laser pulses from aircraft to map terrain hidden under jungle canopy.

buildup.text: The laser passes through gaps in leaves and bounces off the ground, creating a 3D map of the surface.

discovery.text: In 2018, LiDAR revealed 60,000 Maya structures hidden under Guatemalan jungle â€” cities, roads, and farms.

twist.text: The Maya civilization was far larger than anyone thought. LiDAR found it in weeks, not decades.

climax.text: LiDAR is now finding lost temples in Cambodia, forts in the Amazon, and Roman roads in Britain.

punchline.text: Lasers from planes are rewriting ancient history.

quiz.question: What did LiDAR reveal under Guatemalan jungle?
